content.description: Begin up the obvious bulge below the slab.  Use a fun high-step to rock up onto the slab and then commence up the miniscule holds, veering slightly left (there is a key, black colored foot hold out left).  The crux comes after using a gaston to gain a non existent two finger crimp.  From here, use the crimp and a mono crystal to set up for a dynamic lunge up to a not so good right hand gaston.  Super fun!

Begin this route, if you can't reach higher, by using a sharp (but neat) three finger pocket and a triangular crimp low for the right.  Shoot up to a very good ledge edge and figure out how to get to a horn gaston.  From here, move to big holds via even bigger moves, flying out left to a vertical rail.  Move up this to a key jug right where the rope runs over the top.
content.protection: TR, Same as Love Colored Alpinglow
content.location: The next route left of Love Bug's Arete.

content.description: Begin with a high left and crummy right.  Cross to a decent block and then dyno for the big ledge.  Move out to a sloper horn and do some funky foot work to gain the crack above as a gaston.  Techy to the top.  A good route.
content.protection: TR, same as The McCord Accord.
content.location: Just to the right of Mountain Lilly.

content.description: This route took no cleaning and offered amazing, powerful climbing with fun slaps up the steep arete.  Begin by pulling a powerful move up to a left hand side-pull and then gun up for the corner.  Keep slapping back and forth until you get to a horn, where you will transfer to the right and onto the face.  Super route!
content.protection: Use the block on top for setting up your TR...Back it up!
content.location: The obvious arete on the left side of the bloc as you walk to the face.

content.description: Begin on the right side in a corner.  About 5 feet up transfer left onto the face and commence straight up to the top via long pulls of tiny holds.  The crux begins with gaining a right hand sidepull edge and then working the feet up to reach a horrible left hand.  From here dyno to a jug and waltz to the top.
content.protection: TR off the block on top...back it up!
content.location: The front face and namesake of the Green Toupee.
